text: Marduk-zâkir-šumi II was a Babylonian nobleman who served briefly as King of Babylon for a few months in 703 BC, following a revolt against the rule of the Assyrian king Sennacherib. He was soon overthrown and replaced by the former Chaldean king, Marduk-apal-iddina II. Category:703 BC deaths Category:8th- century BC Babylonian kings Category:Babylonian kings Category:Year of birth unknown
title: Marduk-zakir-shumi II
